paper.title: Automated Transformation from Competency List to Tree: Way to Competency-Based Adaptive Knowledge E-Evaluation
paper.abstract: Featured Application The proposed model for competency list transformation to competency tree can be applied in e-learning and e-evaluation systems to ensure integration between systems, using competency lists and competency trees and, at the same time, providing some additional adaptability for the existing e-learning systems. E-learning is rapidly gaining its application. While actively adapting student-oriented learning with the competency evaluation model, the standard of competency support in existing e-learning systems is not implemented and varies. This complicated integration of different e-learning systems or transfer from one system to another might be challenging if the student had his or her competency portfolio in list form, while another system supports tree-based competency portfolios. Therefore, in this paper, we propose a transformation model dedicated to converting the competency list to a competency tree. This solution incorporates text processing and analysis, competency ranking based on Bloom's taxonomy, and competency topic area clustering. The case analysis illustrates the model's capability to generate a qualitative tree from the competency list, where the average accuracy of competency assignment to appropriate parent competency is 72%, but, in some cases, it reaches just 50%.

domain_result.justification: 该论文主要研究的是将能力列表转换为能力树的模型，应用于电子学习和电子评估系统，与金融领域的衍生品定价、金融风险管理和投资组合管理无关。
